author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
Despite the cautionary travel advisory on Jammu and Kashmir by his country, former Australian parliamentarian and ultra-marathon runner Pat Farmer on Wednesday urged tourists across the globe to visit the State for its scenic beauty. Speaking after the culmination of the 4,600-km run, ‘Spirit of India-Kanyakumari to Kashmir’, Mr. Farmer said: “Kashmir Valley has unparalleled beauty, which tourists from all countries should experience by visiting the place at least once in their lifetime.”

While planting a Chinar sapling at the world-famous Mughal Garden Nishat in Srinagar, Mr. Farmer said he would ask his friends and family to definitely come to the Calley to enjoy the natural beauty here.

However, he has a suggestion for the State tourism sector: “Medical as well as adventure tourism should be the focus to lure more international tourism.”

Mr. Farmer’s statement has come as a shot in the arm for the tourism industry as it comes in the backdrop of a negative travel advisory for Jammu and Kashmir.

“Mr. Farmer’s statement will help in removing the negative travel advisory on J&K. It’s a welcome statement. I hope all negative travel advisories on J&K will re-looked after Mr. Farmer’s marathon culminating in Srinagar,” said a top Tourism Department official.
title: Ex Australian MP urges tourists to visit J&K
